title: Lower Mainland targeted shootings 2007
name: Lower Mainland targeted shootings 2007
description:
A Map by Vancouverpapers

Major shooting incidents related to gang violence have become commonplace in the Lower Mainland in the last year. Here are some of the biggest cases to hit the headlines.

properties.name: Aug. 9, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Fortune Happiness Restaurant, 654 E. Broadway Victims: eight; two died: Zachary Ferland, 19, of Prince Rupert and an unidentified 26-year-old man, both known to police. Global B.C. identified one of the surviving victims as Son Boui, a man in his late 20s. Assailant: unknown In what Vancouver police say is likely the worst mass shooting in the city\'s history, two masked gunmen burst into an east-side all-night Chinese restaurant early Thursday and shot eight people in front of horrified onlookers. At least two young men died and a third man was taken to hospital in critical condition, according to Vancouver police spokesman Const. Howard Chow. Five others were taken to hospital with less serious gunshot wounds. The shooting occurred around 4:30 a.m. at the Fortune Happiness Restaurant at 654 East Broadway, in Vancouver\'s Mount Pleasant district, leaving the restaurant shattered. No one has been charged with the crime.

properties.name: Feb. 23, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: 33rd Ave. at Arbutus Street, Vancouver Victim: Miguel Rodriguez (33) Assailant: unknown Rodriguez was shot while driving his black BMW M5 luxury sports car through the intersection at 33rd and Arbutus and smashed into a parked car.

properties.name: Feb. 24, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Smithe and Seymour Victims: Two men in their 20s, unnamed Assailant: unknown At 5 a.m., two men in their 20s were wounded as they were leaving an after-hours nightclub near Smithe and Seymour in downtown Vancouver. One of the victims, a 24-year-old man who was shot in the head, was in critical condition in hospital. "If he lives, he will almost certainly be a paraplegic," Deputy Chief Doug LePard told a news conference.

properties.name: Feb. 25, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: 1900 block West 1st Avenue Victim: Syamac Gafary Asailant: unknown Syamac Gafary, a 32-year-old Burnaby resident with reported ties to Persian gangs, was shot to death in the 1900-block First Avenue at about 9:30 p.m. His record was extensive, with charges across the Lower Mainland dating from 1996 including uttering threats, theft, robbery, break and enter, drug possession, assault, assault causing bodily harm, assault with a weapon causing bodily harm, carrying a concealed weapon, unlawful confinement, and extortion. In most cases, the charges were stayed or Gafary was acquitted but he does have two 1998 convictions for theft and drug possession and another possession conviction in 2001.

properties.name: Feb. 27, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: 1800-block Triumph Street Victim: 64-year-old Richard Bezanson Assailant: unknown 64-year-old Richard Bezanson was found shot in broad daylight in the booze can he operated in the 1800-block of Triumph Street in east Vancouver. He was taken to hospital but died. There was no indication when the shooting occurred and no one reported hearing shots. Police said at the time that the address was known to them, but not Bezanson, who bought two houses side-by-side on the street in 2004. It was frequented by longshoremen and fisherman, as are other booze cans in the neighbourhood of Vancouver\'s industrial waterfront.

properties.name: Jan. 11, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Shell Road and Westminster Highway, Richmond Victim: Kirk Robert Holifield (35) Kirk Robert Holifield, father of a nine-month-old girl, was shot "several times" near the intersection of Shell Road and Westminster Highway in Richmond at about 12:30 a.m. Holifield was found badly wounded, slumped over the wheel of his pickup truck. He died at Vancouver General Hospital. Police believe he was not the intended target, and it was a case of mistaken identity.

properties.name: Jan. 3, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Dover Park (Dover Crescent), Richmond Victims: Niki Tajali (26), Vahid Mahanian (30), Sahand Askari (22). All were wounded and taken to hospital. 150 shots were fired by at least six gunmen gathered in Dover Park, Richmond. Police describe the three victims as "suspects first" in the wild-west-like shootout. Victims included Niki Tajali, 26, who owned a property overlooking the park. Tajali has had a series of run-ins with the law, including a 1998 conviction for assault with a weapon.

properties.name: May 31, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: 500-block W. 10th Victim: 45-year-old William Chan The body of William Chan, a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Tsawwassen, was found slumped forward in a grey Honda Odyssey van parked in the north lane of the 500 block of W.10th Ave. on May 31st. He had been shot. He became Vancouver\'s 7th homicide victim for 2007.

properties.name: Nov. 3, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: 3883 Cartier St., Vancouver Victim: Hong Chao (Raymond) Huang, 45 Assailant: unknown Forty-five-year-old Hong Chao (Raymond) Huang, a leader of the notorious Big Circle Boys gang, was believed to be a major player in the Canadian drug trade, involved in heroin, synthetic drugs, importation of precursor chemicals and more, police sources told The Sun. A native of China, he is believed to have been in Canada for the past 10 years and has criminal ties to Toronto, the United States, Australia, Hong Kong and China. He was the subject of RCMP investigations when he was gunned down by a shooter who was waiting when he arrived home at 3883 Cartier St. about 11 p.m. Saturday, prompting his 10-year-daughter to call 911.

properties.name: Nov. 6, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: 70th Ave at Granville Victims: not yet named Assailant: unknown Two men in their 20s are gunned down in an apparent gangland hit as they idle their luxury vehicle at Granville and 70th in Vancouver at 2:15 am. Police say witnesses saw a dark SUV leaving the scene but they have no suspects identified.

properties.name: Oct. 10, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: McDonalds at Patullo Place and Scott Road, and Surrey Memorial Hospital near King George Highway at 94th Ave. in Surrey. Victim: Dylan Krishna Becker, 38 Assailant: unknown Dylan Krishna Becker, 38, is found shot to death in the 9400-block of King George Highway in Surrey after a 911 call to the area. Police believe that, shortly before his death, Becker had been in an area near Scott Road where numerous gunshots were fired. No one has been charged with the crime.

properties.name: Oct. 10, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersNote: duplicate entry. Please see the Oct. 10 map icon at King George Hwy and 94th Ave. Address: Parking lot of the McDonalds at Patullo Place and Scott Road. Victim: Dylan Krishna Becker, 38 Assailant: unknown Police believe that, shortly before he made a 911 call and died near Surrey Memorial Hospital, Becker had been in an area near Scott Road where numerous gunshots were fired. No one has been charged with the crime.

properties.name: Oct. 19, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Balmoral Tower, 1505-9830 East Whalley Ring Road, Surrey Victims: Ed Schellenberg,55 Chris Mohan, 22 Edward Sousakhone (Eddie) Narong, 22 Corey Jason Michael Lal, 21 Michael Justin Lal, 26 Ryan Bartolomeo, 19 Assailant: unknown Edward Schellenberg, 55, and Christopher Mohan, 22 (in accompanying photo) were among the six people murdered in Surrey on Oct. 19. Neither Schellenberg, a gas fireplace repairman, nor Mohan, a popular basketball fan who lived on the same apartment floor where the killings took place, had any involvement with the criminal world. The four other men had previously been charged with various offences, mainly relating to drug trafficking and weapons.

properties.name: Oct. 31, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Cafe Biennho\' Vietnamese restaurant at 4884 Victoria Drive Victim: 51-yer-old Hiep Quang Do of Richmond Assailant: unknown Vancouver recorded its 17th murder of the year Wednesday when a gunman entered a Vietnamese restaurant at 4884 Victoria Drive and shot and killed a 51-year-old Richmond resident shortly after 9 p.m. The victim was known to police, Vancouver Police spokesman Const. Howard Chow said. Investigators released few details of the killing except to say that they believe it was a targeted shooting. Chow said it was too early in the investigation to say whether the murder was gang-related, or if it was a retaliation shooting.

properties.name: Sept. 11, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Peterson Elementary, 23422 47th Ave, Langley Langley Victim: Len Pelletier, 41 (survived) Len Pelletier, 41, a Langley man with alleged Hells Angels connections, was shot several times after trying to drop off his teenage son at a school. He was about to drop off his 14-year-old son at a high school when he noticed he was being followed by two or three men in another vehicle. He fled the scene, hitting another vehicle before losing control of his Hummer and crashing into a ditch just east of Peterson Road elementary at 23422 47th Ave. The pursuers then pulled up beside the Hummer and fired several rounds into the front and side of the vehicle. Pelletier was taken to hospital with gunshot wounds. His son escaped unharmed. The suspects fled the scene.

properties.name: Sept. 24, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Penticton Street near 11th Ave., next to Vancouver Technical Secondary School, 2600 East Broadway, Vancouver Victim: Jason Chun Sing Louie (34) Assailant: unknown Jay Louie, 34, a Vancouver club promoter known to police was found shot dead in the cab of his black Infinity SUV about 5:30 p.m. on Monday, in the 2500-block Penticton Street between 10th and 12th avenues.

properties.name: Sept. 6, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: No. 2 Road and Dyke Road, Richmond Victim: 27-year-old Ryan Darryl Joaquin Assailant: unknown The body of 27-year-old Ryan Darryl Joaquin was found in the morning on the bank of the Fraser River in Richmond. He was the victim of a targeted murder, police said. Joaquin was known to police and lived in the Vancouver area. The murder was being investigated by the Integrated Homicide Investigation Team (IHIT).

properties.name: Sept. 8, 2007
properties.description: Posted by VancouverpapersAddress: Quattro on Fourth, 2611 W. 4th Ave. Victims: 29-year-old Gurmit Singh Dhak, and an unidentified female (both survived) Assailant: unknown Two people were sent to hospital with gunshot wounds after masked gunmen fired several shots through a plate glass window of Quattro on Fourth restaurant at 2611 W. 4th Ave. The target was 29-year-old Gurmit Singh Dhak, a well-known figure in gang circles and no stranger to gunfire. Two years ago, he was charged with uttering threats to Vancouver police, who had stopped Dhak driving his Lexus SUV after it had been shot up outside Club Uranus, a strip bar on East Broadway.
